meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #7676.

div.div:
Gilbert Collins game 4.
WE ASKED: Iain Armitage.

td.p: Tyler Miksanek, a student from Warrenville, Illinois
Steve Garbacz, a newspaper editor and reporter from Fort Wayne, Indiana
Gilbert Collins, a university administrator from Princeton, New Jersey (whose 3-day cash winnings total $36,599)

tr.td: A WOOLLY CATEGORY
4-LETTER WORDS
ARRIBA ARUBA!
WHOSE ALBUM?
THE END OF TIME
SCIENCE WITH IAIN ARMITAGE
(Iain Armitage: Hi, I'm Iain Armitage, a genius on Young Sheldon and your guide for some science clues.)

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'This word for a sheep\'s coat can also mean a warm woolen pullover')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: This word for a sheep's coat can also mean a warm woolen pullover

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_2_1', 'clue_J_2_1_stuck', 'To clip an animal\'s ears, or to trim a photo')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: To clip an animal's ears, or to trim a photo

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_3_1', 'clue_J_3_1_stuck', '(Jimmy of the Clue Crew shows Aruba\'s flag on the monitor.) The red star on Aruba\'s flag represents the island & the white outline, its sand beaches; the blue represents this body of water')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew shows Aruba's flag on the monitor.) The red star on Aruba's flag represents the island & the white outline, its sand beaches; the blue represents this body of water

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_5_1', 'clue_J_5_1_stuck', 'This period during the Mesozoic Era ended about 145 million years ago, but it\'s still ripping up the box office today!')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: This period during the Mesozoic Era ended about 145 million years ago, but it's still ripping up the box office today!

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_1', 'clue_J_6_1_stuck', '(Iain Armitage presents the clue.) Faults like the San Andreas are named for their movement along the fault plane... this way, which Sheldon\'s dad would know as a sideways pass in football')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Iain Armitage presents the clue.) Faults like the San Andreas are named for their movement along the fault plane... this way, which Sheldon's dad would know as a sideways pass in football

a jersey

SteveTyler
')
